text: Landscape drawings, plant schedule, and planting notes reviewed and approved
Topsoil report (sieve analysis, pH, organic content) reviewed and approved
Plant and sod material submittals (nursery source, species, size) reviewed
Grading complete, debris removed, and irrigation sleeves installed
Topsoil spread to required depth (typically 150–300 mm) and raked smooth
Mulch installed to specified thickness (e.g., 75 mm) around trees and beds
No mulch against tree trunks or plant stems
Trees planted at correct depth with trunk flare exposed
Shrubs and perennials spaced per planting plan
Sod laid tight with staggered joints and watered immediately
Tree staking done securely and does not damage bark
Final inspection of plant health, placement, and finish grade
Irrigation system pressure-tested and zones verified prior to handover
Landscape maintenance plan and warranty period (typically 1–2 years) confirmed

id: • CSA Z614, ASTM D5268, A300 Tree Standards, City Landscape Specs, ISA Guidelines
